comment.author: 64379474@N00
comment._content: I believe that this is the "Propylaea" (gateway) on the Acropolis of Athens. Going through the gateway (which served as a checkpoint) leads you to the Parthenon. Wikipedia page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Propylaea Coordinates: WGS84 37° 58′ 18.2″ N, 23° 43′ 30.5″ E decimal: 37.971722, 23.725139

comment.author: 48153269@N08
comment._content: Beim nächsten Besuch im Ferienhaus in Griechenland dürfen Kultur und viele interessante Ausgrabungen auf keinen Fall fehlen!

comment.author: 7250398@N08
comment._content: This is the Propylaea of Acropolis indeed, and I didn't expect a photographer who is supposed to have experience with ancient monuments, to call these columns as "Corinthian" while they are obviously Doric! He is probably confusing these columns with the, indeed massive Corinthian columns of the temple of Olympian Zeus, in Athens, not very far from Acropolis!
